sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from chemical suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Na: Available from chemical suppliers or local hardware stores; Nd: Obtain from rare earth material suppliers; Sb: Available from chemical suppliers; Tl: Rare element suppliers or online chemical marketplaces
steps: Cs: Purchase from chemical suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich); Na: Available from chemical suppliers or local hardware stores; Nd: Obtain from rare earth material suppliers; Sb: Available from chemical suppliers; Tl: Rare element suppliers or online chemical marketplaces

1. Weigh out 216.00 g of Cesium (Cs) using a precision balance. 2. Weigh 46.00 g of Sodium (Na). 3. Measure 14.00 g of Neodymium (Nd). 4. Weigh 1.00 g of Antimony (Sb). 5. Weigh 1.00 g of Thallium (Tl). 6. Combine all weighed materials in a clean, dry quartz crucible. 7. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic stir rod to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 216.00 g of Cesium (Cs) using a precision balance. 2. Weigh 46.00 g of Sodium (Na). 3. Measure 14.00 g of Neodymium (Nd). 4. Weigh 1.00 g of Antimony (Sb). 5. Weigh 1.00 g of Thallium (Tl). 6. Combine all weighed materials in a clean, dry quartz crucible. 7. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic stir rod to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1000째C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed materials inside the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and reaction of the ingredients.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1000째C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixed materials inside the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and reaction of the ingredients.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature is below 200째C to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature is below 200째C to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the cooled crucible from the furnace using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges of the sample with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth surface finish. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if required for storage or display.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Carefully remove the cooled crucible from the furnace using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Extract the solidified material from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges of the sample with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth surface finish. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface if required for storage or display.
